duties_responsibilities.duty: Function as the focal point in creating a production schedule for projects using the best combination of ERP and other tools, ensuring accuracy and timeliness of the production process.

Provide a means to track and manage daily manufacturing workload, provide feedback to project manager on in-house vs. subcontracted manufacturing hours, and provide regular reporting on manufacturing status.
Interface with engineers, production, and project managers on a daily basis to be familiar with the status of all parts and assemblies in your assigned projects.
Research and assign manufacturing times and due dates on parts as needed.
Monitor quality, service, and delivery issues, and take corrective actions as needed.
Understand technical systems as assigned and manage the critical aspects of the design and schedule.
Stay current and familiar with the status of all parts and assemblies within your assigned projects while balancing conflicting demands on time and resources.
Provide continual improvement of the planning and reporting processes.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Manufacturing, or a related field (Master's or APICS/ASCM certification preferred)
Ability to obtain or have a U.S. Government security clearance
